"AllVehiclesDevScene-wEntry" Scene Setup Steps
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Description:

Create basic all Vehicle Controllers in scene for your Unity
projects using vehicle models from Synty Polygon Battle Royale Asset.

Player Controls:
----------------

Player Forward:   W
Player Reverse:   S
Player Left:      A
Player Right:     D
Player Jump:      Space
Player Sprint:    Left Shift


Vehicle Controls: 
-----------------

Vehicle Forward:  W
Vehicle Reverse:  S
Turn Left:        A
Turn Right:       D
Apply Brake:      Space
Enter Vehicle:    E
Exit Vehicle:     F

Manual Setup Instruction:
-------------------------


* Simply follow the instruction for manual setup found below.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Prep Step: Create New Scene Called: "AllVehiclesDevScene-wEntry"

Note: if you already have some sort of a test terrain in place, well then, you
can simple skip the steps: #1, 2 & 3 and go directly to #4.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 1: Create: "Environment" * (for Nicer Organization)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create Empty: "Environment"

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

First since this is just a "holder" added for better organization, let us go
ahead & drag the "Directional Light" into "Environment".

* also if you wanted you could add a "dir" called Environment and opt to place
  your TerrainData inside that in its own Dir "TerrainData" and as such any
  other Environment stuff respectively in as desired the "Environment" dir.
  Just a suggestion.

Also: We don't need the "Main Camera" in Sample Scene, so..., we can go ahead
and delete it.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 2: Create: "Terrain Plane"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create New 3D Object: "Plane"

Position: X: 0   Y: -0.03 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0   Y: 0     Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 800 Y: 1     Z: 800

Rename to: "Terrain Plane"

We can now opt to clean up for better organization, simply drag the:
"Terrain Plane" into the holder "Environment" we added for just this exact
 purpose!


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 3: Create: "Terrain"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create New 3D Object: "Terrain"

Modify via:

"Terrain" Inspector: Terrain Settings

Mesh Resolution:

Terrain Width: 8000
Terrain Length: 8000

Modify via:

"Terrain" Inspector: "Transform"

Position: X: -4000 Y: 0 Z: -4000 
Rotation: X: 0     Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1     Y: 1 Z: 1

We can now opt to clean up for better organization, simply drag the:
"Terrain" into the holder "Environment" we added for just this exact purpose!


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 4: Create: object "Player":

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create empty object and name such: "Player"

Transform: 
----------

Position: X: 0 Y: 0.9799998 Z: -10 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0  Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1  Z: 1

Add Tag: "Player"


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 5: Add: empty object "View":

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Player" object, create a child of the "Player" object and name
such: "View"

Transform Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 6: Add: "Camera":

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In "Player" object, add a Camera component as child of "View" and name
such: "Camera"

Transform: 
----------

Position: X: 0 Y: 0.6 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0   Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1   Z: 1

Depth: "1" 

Add Tag: "MainCamera"


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 7: Edit: the "CharacterController" component:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Player" object, edit the "CharacterController" component:

Height: "1.8"


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 8: Add Component: "First Person Controller (Script)"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Add: "FirstPersonController.cs" script to object: "Player"


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 9: Setup: Audio Source and Footstep Sounds Audio Clips:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In "Player" object edit: the "First Person Controller (Script)"

Footstep Source: Player (AudioSource)

Footsep Sounds: "4"

Element 0: "Footstep01"
Element 1: "Footstep02"
Element 2: "Footstep03"
Element 3: "Footstep04"


That is it! You should now be able to run around your scene!


But..., for now since we do not need the player controller at this point let
us disable the player object / component in inspector for now until we need it


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 10: Create: empty "Interface"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create an empty called: "Interface"

Layer: "UI"

Transform: 
----------

Position: X: 0 Y: 0   Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0   Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1   Z: 1 


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 11: In "Interface" Add UI: "Canvas"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create as a child of "Interface" Add a UI: "Canvas"


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 12: Create as child of "Canvas" add empty: "VehiclesEntry"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Create as a child of "Interface" add empty: "VehiclesEntry"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Bottom Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: 50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 13:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "ArmoredTruck01_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "ArmoredTruck01_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 14: Create: empty "Vehicles"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Now that you disabled the interface, let us go back in your scene heirarchy and...

Create Empty: "Vehicles"

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your scene heirarchy at top should look like this:

Environment
Player
Vehicle
Interface
EventSystem

Nice and organized right?! :) Good Stuff! ;)

Note: as this uses a vehicle from such and due to licensing such vehicles
cannot be included in this repository obviously, as such the provided scripts
and instructions thus require having / purchasing the:

Synty Polygon Battle Royale Asset:
https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/urban/polygon-battle-royale-low-poly-3d-art-by-synty-128513


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 15: Install: "Synty Polygon Battle Royal Asset"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Depending on how you purchased you can either use the package manager to
install the asset or if you are like me and say already have local repository
storage of purchased assets and have the package already you can install the
asset manually.

Asset package to install:

 POLYGON Battle Royale - Low Poly 3D Art by Synty.unitypackage

Purchase Synty Polygon Battle Royale Asset:
https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/urban/polygon-battle-royale-low-poly-3d-art-by-synty-128513


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 16: Identify: the "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 17: Add: the "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01 => "ArmoredTruck01"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -123 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_01

Then move "ArmoredTruck01" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 18: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck01" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 19: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "ArmoredTruck01Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "ArmoredTruck01Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 20: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck01" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 21: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck01" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your vehicle heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View

Fully Expanded:

Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01
    WheelMeshes
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
    WheelColliders
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_rmored_Car_Wheel_rr    
    View
      ArmoredTruck01Camera


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 22: Add to: ArmoredTruck01 (ArmoredTruck01Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck01Controller.cs) to "ArmoredTruck01"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: ArmoredTruck01 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3000

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 23: Add to: ArmoredTruck01Camera (ArmoredTruck01TruckCamera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck01Camera.cs) to "ArmoredTruck01Camera"


Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck01 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 24: Add to: ArmoredTruck01 (ArmoredTruck01Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck01Entry.cs) to "ArmoredTruck01"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck01
Player: Player
InterfaceText Object: ArmoredTruck01_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.05058646 Y: 1.296817 Z: -0.1289468
Size: X: 3.328609 Y: 1.51396 Z: 1.540893


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 25: In Interface > Canvas create empty child: "VehiclesSpeed"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "VehiclesSpeed"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Bottom Left

Pos X: 146.3
Pos Y: 143

Width: 300
Height: 300


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 26: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "ArmoredTruck01Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck01Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 27: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 28: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 29: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 30: In Vehicle > ArmoredTruck01 attach script: (ArmoredTruck01Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach ArmoredTruck01Speedometer script: (ArmoredTruck01Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "ArmoredTruck01"

In: "ArmoredTruck01" > ArmoredTruck01 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: ArmoredTruck01_Needle

Speed Text: ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

GameObjects:

Interface Parent Object: ArmoredTruck01_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

ArmoredTruck01Speedometer
ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoGuage
ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoNeedle
ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Environment
Player
Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View
Interface
  Canvas
    VehiclesSpeed
    VehiclesEntry
EventSystem


Fully Expanded:

Environment
  Directional Light
  Terrain
  Terrain Plane
Player
  View
    Camera
Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01
    WheelMeshes
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
    WheelColliders
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_rmored_Car_Wheel_rr    
    View
      ArmoredTruck01Camera
Interface
  Canvas
    VehiclesSpeed
      ArmoredTruck01Speedometer
        ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoGuage
        ArmoredTruck01_SpeedoNeedle
        ArmoredTruck01_SpeedText 
    VehiclesEntry
      ArmoredTruck01_EntryKey
EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 31:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "ArmoredTruck02_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "ArmoredTruck02_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input:  Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----

Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 32: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 33: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01 => "ArmoredTruck02"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -117 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_02

Then move "ArmoredTruck02" into the empty: "Vehicle" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 34: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck02" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 35: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "ArmoredTruck02Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "ArmoredTruck02Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 36: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck02" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 37: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck02" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your vehicle heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View
  ArmoredTruck02
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View

Fully Expanded:

Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01
    WheelMeshes
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
    WheelColliders
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_rmored_Car_Wheel_rr    
    View
      ArmoredTruck01Camera
  ArmoredTruck02
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01
    WheelMeshes
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
    WheelColliders
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
      SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
      SM_Veh_rmored_Car_Wheel_rr    
    View
      ArmoredTruck02Camera

Step 38: Add to: ArmoredTruck02 (ArmoredTruck02Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck02Controller.cs) to "ArmoredTruck02"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: ArmoredTruck02 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3000


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 39: Add to: ArmoredTruck02Camera (ArmoredTruck02TruckCamera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck02Camera.cs) to "ArmoredTruck02Camera"


Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck02 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 40: Add to: ArmoredTruck02 (ArmoredTruck02Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck02Entry.cs) to "ArmoredTruck02"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck02
Player: Player
InterfaceText Object: ArmoredTruck02_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.05058646 Y: 1.296817 Z: -0.1289468
Size: X: 3.328609 Y: 1.51396 Z: 1.540893


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 41: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "ArmoredTruck02Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck02Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 42: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 43: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"

Step 44: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "ArmoredTruck02_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "ArmoredTruck02_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 45: In Vehicle > ArmoredTruck02 attach script: (ArmoredTruck02Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach ArmoredTruck02Speedometer script: (ArmoredTruck02Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "ArmoredTruck02"

In: "ArmoredTruck02" > ArmoredTruck02 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: ArmoredTruck02_Needle

Speed Text: ArmoredTruck02_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

GameObjects:

Interface Parent Object: ArmoredTruck02_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: ArmoredTruck02_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

ArmoredTruck02Speedometer
ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoGuage
ArmoredTruck02_SpeedoNeedle
ArmoredTruck02_SpeedText

Step 46:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "ArmoredTruck03_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "ArmoredTruck03_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input:  Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----

Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 47: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 48: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01 => "ArmoredTruck03"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -111 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_03

Then move "ArmoredTruck03" into the empty: "Vehicle" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 49: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck03" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 50: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "ArmoredTruck03Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "ArmoredTruck03Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 51: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck03" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 52: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 60: In Vehicle > ArmoredTruck03 attach script: (ArmoredTruck03Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach ArmoredTruck03Speedometer script: (ArmoredTruck03Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "ArmoredTruck03"

In: "ArmoredTruck03" > ArmoredTruck03 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: ArmoredTruck03_Needle

Speed Text: ArmoredTruck03_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: ArmoredTruck03_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: ArmoredTruck03_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: ArmoredTruck03_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: ArmoredTruck03_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

ArmoredTruck03Speedometer
ArmoredTruck03_SpeedoGuage
ArmoredTruck03_SpeedoNeedle
ArmoredTruck03_SpeedText

Step 61:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "ArmoredTruck04_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "ArmoredTruck04_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input:  Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----

Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 62: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 63: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01 => "ArmoredTruck04"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -105 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_04

Then move "ArmoredTruck04" into the empty: "Vehicle" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 64: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck04" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 65: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "ArmoredTruck04Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "ArmoredTruck04Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 66: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck04" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 67: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck04" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 68: Add to: ArmoredTruck04 (ArmoredTruck04Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck04Controller.cs) to "ArmoredTruck04"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: ArmoredTruck04 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3000


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck04 (Transform)

Step 70: Add to: ArmoredTruck04 (ArmoredTruck04Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck04Entry.cs) to "ArmoredTruck04"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck04
Player: Player
InterfaceText Object: ArmoredTruck04_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.05058646 Y: 1.296817 Z: -0.1289468
Size: X: 3.328609 Y: 1.51396 Z: 1.540893


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 71: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "ArmoredTruck04Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck04Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input:  Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----

Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 77: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 78: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_01 => "ArmoredTruck05"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -99 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_05

Then move "ArmoredTruck05" into the empty: "Vehicle" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 79: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck05" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 80: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "ArmoredTruck05Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "ArmoredTruck05Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 81: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck05" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.5421047 Z: 1.730696 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 82: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck05" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 83: Add to: ArmoredTruck05 (ArmoredTruck05Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck05Controller.cs) to "ArmoredTruck05"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: ArmoredTruck05 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3000


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck05Camera.cs) to "ArmoredTruck05Camera"


Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck05 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 85: Add to: ArmoredTruck05 (ArmoredTruck05Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (ArmoredTruck05Entry.cs) to "ArmoredTruck05"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Armored Truck: ArmoredTruck05
Player: Player
InterfaceText Object: ArmoredTruck05_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.05058646 Y: 1.296817 Z: -0.1289468
Size: X: 3.328609 Y: 1.51396 Z: 1.540893


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 86: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "ArmoredTruck05Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck05Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Height: 50

-----------

0 mph

Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 90: In Vehicle > ArmoredTruck05 attach script: (ArmoredTruck05Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach ArmoredTruck05Speedometer script: (ArmoredTruck05Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "ArmoredTruck05"

In: "ArmoredTruck05" > ArmoredTruck05 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: ArmoredTruck05_Needle

Speed Text: ArmoredTruck05_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

GameObjects:

Interface Parent Object: ArmoredTruck05_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: ArmoredTruck05_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: ArmoredTruck05_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: ArmoredTruck05_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

ArmoredTruck05Speedometer
ArmoredTruck05_SpeedoGuage
ArmoredTruck05_SpeedoNeedle
ArmoredTruck05_SpeedText

Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.5421047 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 97: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck06" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.5407741
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.6907741 (0.5407741+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5407741

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9126655 Y: 0.6907741 Z: 1.730696
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.048778 Y: 0.6907741 Z: -1.581318
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3000

----------------

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.05058646 Y: 1.296817 Z: -0.1289468
Size: X: 3.328609 Y: 1.51396 Z: 1.540893

Step 101: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "ArmoredTruck06Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "ArmoredTruck06Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.

the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

ArmoredTruck06Speedometer
ArmoredTruck06_SpeedoGuage
ArmoredTruck06_SpeedoNeedle

-----

can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Step 112: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy01" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 113: Add to: DuneBuggy01 (DuneBuggy01Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy01Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy01"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy01 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000

Step 115: Add to: DuneBuggy01 (DuneBuggy01Entry.cs)

Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy01
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy01_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885

Step 116: In Interface > Canvas create empty child: "VehiclesSpeed"

---------------

Bottom Left

Pos X: 146.3
Pos Y: 143

Width: 300
Height: 300


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 117: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy01Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 121: In Vehicles > DuneBuggy01 attach script: (DuneBuggy01Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach DuneBuggy01Speedometer script: (DuneBuggy01Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "DuneBuggy01"

In: "DuneBuggy01" > DuneBuggy01 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: DuneBuggy01_Needle

Speed Text: DuneBuggy01_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: DuneBuggy01_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: DuneBuggy01_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: DuneBuggy01_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy01_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

DuneBuggy01Speedometer
DuneBuggy01_SpeedoGuage
DuneBuggy01_SpeedoNeedle
DuneBuggy01_SpeedText

Step 122:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "DuneBuggy02_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "DuneBuggy02_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...

Next, rename the vehicle prefab:

SM_Veh_Buggy_01 => "DuneBuggy02"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -81 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_02

Then move "DuneBuggy02" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.
