Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)



Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

---------------------------

Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

---------------------------

Step 128: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy02" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 129: Add to: DuneBuggy02 (DuneBuggy02Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy02Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy02"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy02 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 130: Add to: DuneBuggy02Camera (DuneBuggy02Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy02Camera.cs) to "DuneBuggy02Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy02 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 131: Add to: DuneBuggy02 (DuneBuggy02Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy02Entry.cs) to "DuneBuggy02"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy02
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy02_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 132: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy02Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "DuneBuggy02_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 134: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "DuneBuggy02_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "DuneBuggy02_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 135: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "DuneBuggy02_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "DuneBuggy02_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 136: In Vehicles > DuneBuggy02 attach script: (DuneBuggy02Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach DuneBuggy02Speedometer script: (DuneBuggy02Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "DuneBuggy02"

In: "DuneBuggy02" > DuneBuggy02 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: DuneBuggy02_Needle

Speed Text: DuneBuggy02_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: DuneBuggy02_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: DuneBuggy02_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: DuneBuggy02_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy02_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

DuneBuggy02Speedometer
DuneBuggy02_SpeedoGuage
DuneBuggy02_SpeedoNeedle
DuneBuggy02_SpeedText

Step 137:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "DuneBuggy03_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "DuneBuggy03_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 138: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Buggy_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 139: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefab:

SM_Veh_Buggy_01 => "DuneBuggy03"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -75 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_03

Then move "DuneBuggy03" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 140: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy03" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 141: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "DuneBuggy03Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "DuneBuggy03Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 142: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy03" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)



Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 143: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy03" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 144: Add to: DuneBuggy03 (DuneBuggy03Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy03Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy03"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy03 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000

Step 146: Add to: DuneBuggy03 (DuneBuggy03Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy03Entry.cs) to "DuneBuggy03"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy03
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy03_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885

Step 147: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy03Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 150: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "DuneBuggy03_SpeedText"

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 151: In Vehicles > DuneBuggy03 attach script: (DuneBuggy03Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach DuneBuggy03Speedometer script: (DuneBuggy03Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "DuneBuggy03"

In: "DuneBuggy03" > DuneBuggy03 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: DuneBuggy03_Needle

Speed Text: DuneBuggy03_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: DuneBuggy03_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: DuneBuggy03_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: DuneBuggy03_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy03_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

DuneBuggy03Speedometer
DuneBuggy03_SpeedoGuage
DuneBuggy03_SpeedoNeedle
DuneBuggy03_SpeedText

      ArmoredTruck01_EntryKey
      ArmoredTruck02_EntryKey 
      ArmoredTruck03_EntryKey
      ArmoredTruck04_EntryKey
      ArmoredTruck05_EntryKey        
      ArmoredTruck06_EntryKey    
      DuneBuggy01_EntryKey    
      DuneBuggy02_EntryKey
      DuneBuggy03_EntryKey      
EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 152:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "DuneBuggy04_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "DuneBuggy04_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 153: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Buggy_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 154: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefab:

SM_Veh_Buggy_01 => "DuneBuggy04"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -69 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_04

Then move "DuneBuggy04" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 155: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy04" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 156: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "DuneBuggy04Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "DuneBuggy04Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 157: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy04" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)



Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 158: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy04" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 159: Add to: DuneBuggy04 (DuneBuggy04Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy04Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy04"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy04 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000

Step 161: Add to: DuneBuggy04 (DuneBuggy04Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy04Entry.cs) to "DuneBuggy04"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy04
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy04_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885

Step 162: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy04Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Step 167:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "DuneBuggy05_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "DuneBuggy05_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 168: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Buggy_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 169: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefab:

SM_Veh_Buggy_01 => "DuneBuggy05"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -63 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_05

Then move "DuneBuggy05" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 170: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy05" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 171: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "DuneBuggy05Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "DuneBuggy05Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 172: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy05" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)



Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 173: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy05" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 174: Add to: DuneBuggy05 (DuneBuggy05Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy05Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy05"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy05 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy05Camera.cs) to "DuneBuggy05Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy05 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 176: Add to: DuneBuggy05 (DuneBuggy05Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy05Entry.cs) to "DuneBuggy05"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy05
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy05_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 177: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy05Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Height: 300

Height: 50

0 mph

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 181: In Vehicles > DuneBuggy05 attach script: (DuneBuggy05Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach DuneBuggy05Speedometer script: (DuneBuggy05Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "DuneBuggy05"

In: "DuneBuggy05" > DuneBuggy05 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: DuneBuggy05_Needle

Speed Text: DuneBuggy05_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: DuneBuggy05_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: DuneBuggy05_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: DuneBuggy05_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy05_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

DuneBuggy05Speedometer
DuneBuggy05_SpeedoGuage
DuneBuggy05_SpeedoNeedle
DuneBuggy05_SpeedText

Step 182:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "DuneBuggy06_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "DuneBuggy06_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 183: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Buggy_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 184: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefab:

SM_Veh_Buggy_01 => "DuneBuggy06"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -57 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_06

Then move "DuneBuggy06" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 185: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy06" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 186: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "DuneBuggy06Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "DuneBuggy06Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 187: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy06" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)



Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: -0.3026607 Z: -0.05304886
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.5000129 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 188: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "DuneBuggy06" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Shocks_01
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
    SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y:  (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer


Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
  SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.5032759


We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9051619 Y: 0.650013 Z: 1.846053
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl
---------------------

Position: X: -0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr
---------------------

Position: X: 0.9837266 Y: 0.6532759 Z: -1.294653
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 189: Add to: DuneBuggy06 (DuneBuggy06Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy06Controller.cs) to "DuneBuggy06"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: DuneBuggy06 (Rigidbody)


Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Transform)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Transform) 


WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front: Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)      
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Buggy_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1000

Step 191: Add to: DuneBuggy06 (DuneBuggy06Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (DuneBuggy06Entry.cs) to "DuneBuggy06"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Dune Buggy: DuneBuggy06
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy06_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.03706616 Y: 1.066822 Z: 0.02607679
Size: X: 4.030926 Y: 1.303131 Z: 1.31885
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 192: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "DunebBuggySpeedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "DuneBuggy06Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Height: 300

Step 195: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "DuneBuggy06_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "DuneBuggy06_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 196: In Vehicles > DuneBuggy06 attach script: (DuneBuggy06Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach DuneBuggy06Speedometer script: (DuneBuggy06Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "DuneBuggy06"

In: "DuneBuggy06" > DuneBuggy06 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: DuneBuggy06_Needle

Speed Text: DuneBuggy06_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: DuneBuggy06_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: DuneBuggy06_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: DuneBuggy06_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: DuneBuggy06_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

DuneBuggy06Speedometer
DuneBuggy06_SpeedoGuage
DuneBuggy06_SpeedoNeedle
DuneBuggy06_SpeedText

Step 197:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee01_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee01_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 198: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 199: Add: the "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee01"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -51 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_01

Then move "Humvee01" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 200: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee01" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 201: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee01Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee01Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 202: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee01" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 203: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee01" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 204: Add to: Humvee01 (Humvee01Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee01Controller.cs) to "Humvee01"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee01 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee01Camera.cs) to "Humvee01Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee01: Humvee01 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 206: Add to: Humvee01 (Humvee01Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee01Entry.cs) to "Humvee01"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee01: Humvee01
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee01_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 207: In Interface > Canvas create empty child: "VehiclesSpeed"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "VehiclesSpeed"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Bottom Left

Pos X: 146.3
Pos Y: 143

Width: 300
Height: 300


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 208: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee01Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee01Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 209: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "Humvee01_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee01_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 210: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Humvee01_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee01_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 211: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Humvee01_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee01_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 212: In Vehicles > Humvee01 attach script: (Humvee01Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee01Speedometer script: (Humvee01Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee01"

In: "Humvee01" > Humvee01 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee01_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee01_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee01_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee01_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee01_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee01_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee01Speedometer
Humvee01_SpeedoGuage
Humvee01_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee01_SpeedText

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 213:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee02_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee02_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 214: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 215: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee02"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -45 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_02

Then move "Humvee02" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 216: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee02" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 217: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee02Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee02Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 218: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee02" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 219: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee02" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 220: Add to: Humvee02 (Humvee02Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee02Controller.cs) to "Humvee02"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee02 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee02: Humvee02 (Transform)

Step 222: Add to: Humvee02 (Humvee02Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee02Entry.cs) to "Humvee02"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee02: Humvee02
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee02_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 223: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee02Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee02Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.

Step 227: In Vehicles > Humvee02 attach script: (Humvee02Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee02Speedometer script: (Humvee02Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee02"

In: "Humvee02" > Humvee02 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee02_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee02_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee02_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee02_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee02_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee02_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee02Speedometer
Humvee02_SpeedoGuage
Humvee02_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee02_SpeedText
