Step 228:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee03_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee03_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 229: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 230: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee03"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -39 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_03

Then move "Humvee03" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 231: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee03" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 232: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee03Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee03Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 233: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee03" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 234: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee03" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 235: Add to: Humvee03 (Humvee03Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee03Controller.cs) to "Humvee03"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee03 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 236: Add to: Humvee03Camera (Humvee03Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee03Camera.cs) to "Humvee03Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee03: Humvee03 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 237: Add to: Humvee03 (Humvee03Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee03Entry.cs) to "Humvee03"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee03: Humvee03
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee03_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 238: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee03Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee03Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 239: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "Humvee03_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee03_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 240: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Humvee03_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee03_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 241: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Humvee03_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee03_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 242: In Vehicles > Humvee03 attach script: (Humvee03Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee03Speedometer script: (Humvee03Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee03"

In: "Humvee03" > Humvee03 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee03_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee03_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee03_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee03_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee03_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee03_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee03Speedometer
Humvee03_SpeedoGuage
Humvee03_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee03_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 243:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee04_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee04_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 244: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 245: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee04"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -33 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_04

Then move "Humvee04" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 246: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee04" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 247: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee04Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee04Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 248: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee04" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 249: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee04" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 250: Add to: Humvee04 (Humvee04Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee04Controller.cs) to "Humvee04"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee04 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee04: Humvee04 (Transform)

Step 252: Add to: Humvee04 (Humvee04Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee04Entry.cs) to "Humvee04"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee04: Humvee04
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee04_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 253: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee04Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee04Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee04_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 255: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Humvee04_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee04_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 256: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Humvee04_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee04_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 257: In Vehicles > Humvee04 attach script: (Humvee04Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee04Speedometer script: (Humvee04Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee04"

In: "Humvee04" > Humvee04 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee04_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee04_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee04_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee04_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee04_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee04_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee04Speedometer
Humvee04_SpeedoGuage
Humvee04_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee04_SpeedText

Step 258:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee05_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee05_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 259: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 260: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee05"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -27 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_05

Then move "Humvee05" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 261: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee05" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 262: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee05Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee05Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 263: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee05" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 264: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee05" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 265: Add to: Humvee05 (Humvee05Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee05Controller.cs) to "Humvee05"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee05 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 266: Add to: Humvee05Camera (Humvee05Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee05Camera.cs) to "Humvee05Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee05: Humvee05 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 267: Add to: Humvee05 (Humvee05Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee05Entry.cs) to "Humvee05"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee05: Humvee05
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee05_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 268: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee05Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee05Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 269: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "Humvee05_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee05_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 230: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Humvee05_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee05_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 231: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Humvee05_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee05_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 232: In Vehicles > Humvee05 attach script: (Humvee05Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee05Speedometer script: (Humvee05Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee05"

In: "Humvee05" > Humvee05 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee05_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee05_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee05_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee05_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee05_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee05_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee05Speedometer
Humvee05_SpeedoGuage
Humvee05_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee05_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Environment
Player

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 233:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Humvee06_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Humvee06_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 234: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 235: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_01 => "Humvee06"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -21 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_06

Then move "Humvee06" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 236: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee06" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 237: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Humvee06Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Humvee06Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 238: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee06" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr


Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure and sdo note this particular model has some issues because the
designer actually has the back wheels incorrect as they are opposite
regardless of how they are named and not what they should be and unless you
notrice that you might run inot issues so let us correct that now:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.4136755 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.4136755 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 239: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Humvee06" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "VWheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.4145404
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.5645404 (0.4145404+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.4145404

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.8390951 Y: 0.5645404 Z: 1.70215
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl
---------------------------------

Position: X: -0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr
---------------------------------

Position: X: 0.9434342 Y: 0.5645404 Z: -1.524809
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your vehicle heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View

    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View     
  ArmoredTruck03
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View 
  ArmoredTruck04
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 240: Add to: Humvee06 (Humvee06Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee06Controller.cs) to "Humvee06"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Humvee06 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Light_Armored_Car_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 2500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 241: Add to: Humvee06Camera (Humvee06Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee06Camera.cs) to "Humvee06Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Humvee06: Humvee06 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 242: Add to: Humvee06 (Humvee06Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Humvee06Entry.cs) to "Humvee06"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Humvee06: Humvee06
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Humvee06_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.0003892779 Y: 0.9888325 Z: -0.05741239
Size: X: 3.561238 Y: 1.514789 Z: 1.951702
  

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 243: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Humvee06Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee06Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 244: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add UI IMG: "Humvee06_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee06_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 245: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Humvee06_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee06_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 246: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Humvee06_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Humvee06_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 247: In Vehicles > Humvee06 attach script: (Humvee06Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Humvee06Speedometer script: (Humvee06Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "Humvee06"

In: "Humvee06" > Humvee06 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: Humvee06_Needle

Speed Text: Humvee06_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Humvee06_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Humvee06_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Humvee06_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Humvee06_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Humvee06Speedometer
Humvee06_SpeedoGuage
Humvee06_SpeedoNeedle
Humvee06_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 248:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan01_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan01_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 249: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 250: Add: the "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan01"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -15 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_01

Then move "Sedan01" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 251: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan01" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 252: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan01Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan01Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 253: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan01" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 254: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan01" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 255: Add to: Sedan01 (Sedan01Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan01Controller.cs) to "Sedan01"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan01 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 256: Add to: Sedan01Camera (Sedan01Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan01Camera.cs) to "Sedan01Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan01: Sedan01 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 257: Add to: Sedan01 (Sedan01Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan01Entry.cs) to "Sedan01"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan01: Sedan01
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan01_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 258: In Interface > Canvas create empty child: "VehiclesSpeed"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "VehiclesSpeed"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Bottom Left

Pos X: 146.3
Pos Y: 143

Width: 300
Height: 300


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 259: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan01Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan01Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 260: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan01_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan01_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 261: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan01_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan01_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 262: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan01_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan01_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 263: In Vehicle > Sedan01 attach script: (Sedan01Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan01Speedometer script: (Sedan01Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan01"

In: "Sedan01" > Sedan01 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan01_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan01_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan01_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan01_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan01_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan01_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan01Speedometer
Sedan01_SpeedoGuage
Sedan01_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan01_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 264:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan02_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan02_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 265: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 266: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan02"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -9 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_02

Then move "Sedan02" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 267: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan02" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 268: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan02Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan02Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 269: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan02" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 270: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan02" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
