-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 271: Add to: Sedan02 (Sedan02Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan02Controller.cs) to "Sedan02"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan02 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 272: Add to: Sedan02Camera (Sedan02Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan02Camera.cs) to "Sedan02Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan02: Sedan02 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 273: Add to: Sedan02 (Sedan02Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan02Entry.cs) to "Sedan02"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan02: Sedan02
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan02_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 274: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan02Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan02Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 275: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan02_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan02_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 276: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan02_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan02_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 277: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan02_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan02_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 278: In Vehicle s> Sedan02 attach script: (Sedan02Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan02Speedometer script: (Sedan02Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan02"

In: "Sedan02" > Sedan02 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan02_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan02_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan02_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan02_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan02_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan02_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan02Speedometer
Sedan02_SpeedoGuage
Sedan02_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan02_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 279:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan03_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan03_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 280: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 281: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan03"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: -3 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_03

Then move "Sedan03" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 282: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan03" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 283: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan03Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan03Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 284: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan03" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 285: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan03" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 286: Add to: Sedan03 (Sedan03Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan03Controller.cs) to "Sedan03"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan03 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 287: Add to: Sedan03Camera (Sedan03Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan03Camera.cs) to "Sedan03Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan03: Sedan03 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 288: Add to: Sedan03 (Sedan03Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan03Entry.cs) to "Sedan03"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan03: Sedan03
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan03_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 289: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan03Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan03Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 290: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan03_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan03_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 291: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan03_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan03_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 292: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan03_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan03_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 293: In Vehicle s> Sedan03 attach script: (Sedan03Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan03Speedometer script: (Sedan03Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan03"

In: "Sedan03" > Sedan03 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan03_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan03_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan03_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan03_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan03_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan03_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan03Speedometer
Sedan03_SpeedoGuage
Sedan03_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan03_SpeedText

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 294:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan04_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan04_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 295: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 296: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan04"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 3 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_04

Then move "Sedan04" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 297: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan04" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 298: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan04Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan04Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 299: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan04" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 300: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan04" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 301: Add to: Sedan04 (Sedan04Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan04Controller.cs) to "Sedan04"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan04 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 302: Add to: Sedan04Camera (Sedan04Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan04Camera.cs) to "Sedan04Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan04: Sedan04 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 303: Add to: Sedan04 (Sedan04Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan04Entry.cs) to "Sedan04"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan04: Sedan04
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan04_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 304: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan04Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan04Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 305: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan04_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan04_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 306: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan04_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan04_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 307: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan04_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan04_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 308: In Vehicle s> Sedan04 attach script: (Sedan04Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan04Speedometer script: (Sedan04Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan04"

In: "Sedan04" > Sedan04 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan04_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan04_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan04_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan04_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan04_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan04_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan04Speedometer
Sedan04_SpeedoGuage
Sedan04_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan04_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 309:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan05_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan05_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 310: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 311: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan05"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 9 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_05

Then move "Sedan05" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 312: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan05" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 313: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan05Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan05Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 314: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan05" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 315: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan05" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 316: Add to: Sedan05 (Sedan05Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan05Controller.cs) to "Sedan05"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan05 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 317: Add to: Sedan05Camera (Sedan05Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan05Camera.cs) to "Sedan05Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan05: Sedan05 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 318: Add to: Sedan05 (Sedan05Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan05Entry.cs) to "Sedan05"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan05: Sedan05
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan05_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 319: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan05Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan05Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 320: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan05_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan05_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 321: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan05_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan05_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 322: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan05_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan05_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 323: In Vehicle s> Sedan05 attach script: (Sedan05Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan05Speedometer script: (Sedan05Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan05"

In: "Sedan05" > Sedan05 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan05_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan05_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan05_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan05_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan05_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan05_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan05Speedometer
Sedan05_SpeedoGuage
Sedan05_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan05_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 324:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "Sedan06_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "Sedan06_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 325: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Car_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 326: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Car_01 => "Sedan06"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 15 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_06

Then move "Sedan06" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 327: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan06" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 328: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "Sedan06Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "Sedan06Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 1.4 Z: -6.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 329: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan06" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure. 

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.361439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.361439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: -180 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Also you will note, that some of the wheel meshes have a -180 on the rotation,
that is fine, the provided script for this particular model has edits to
factor for those rotations so as to not conflict with Wheel Colliders
functionality.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 330: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "Sedan06" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15)  *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.3614392
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.511439 (0.3614392+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439
Set both rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.361439

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.7100819 Y: 0.511439 Z: 1.619223
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl
---------------------------

Position: X: -0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr
---------------------------

Position: X: 0.8224078 Y: 0.511439 Z: -1.130083
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 331: Add to: Sedan06 (Sedan06Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan06Controller.cs) to "Sedan06"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: Sedan06 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Transform)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Transform) 

WheelColliders:
---------------

Font Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rl (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right: SM_Veh_Car_01_Wheel_rr (Wheel Collider) 

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 1500

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 332: Add to: Sedan06Camera (Sedan06Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan06Camera.cs) to "Sedan06Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Sedan06: Sedan06 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 333: Add to: Sedan06 (Sedan06Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (Sedan06Entry.cs) to "Sedan06"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Sedan06: Sedan06
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: Sedan06_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: -0.06134325 Y: 0.8881476 Z: 0.1162676
Size: X: 3.262136 Y: 1.416598 Z: 1.655701


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 334: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "Sedan06Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In: "Sedan06Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 335: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan06_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan06_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 336: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "Sedan06_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan06_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 337: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "Sedan06_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "Sedan06_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 338: In Vehicle s> Sedan06 attach script: (Sedan06Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach Sedan06Speedometer script: (Sedan06Speedometer.cs) to Vehicle: "Sedan06"

In: "Sedan06" > Sedan06 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and Speed Text)

Needle: Sedan06_Needle

Speed Text: Sedan06_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: Sedan06_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: Sedan06_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: Sedan06_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: Sedan06_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

Sedan06Speedometer
Sedan06_SpeedoGuage
Sedan06_SpeedoNeedle
Sedan06_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 339:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck01_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck01_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 340: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 341: Add: the "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck01"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 21 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_01

Then move "SixWheelTruck01" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 342: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck01" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 343: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck01Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck01Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 344: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck01" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 345: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck01" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mostly Collapsed:

    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01

    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View 
  ArmoredTruck04

Step 346: Add to: SixWheelTruck01 (SixWheelTruck01Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck01Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck01"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck01 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 347: Add to: SixWheelTruck01Camera (SixWheelTruck01Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck01Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck01Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck01 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 348: Add to: SixWheelTruck01 (SixWheelTruck01Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck01Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck01"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck01
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck01_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 349: In Interface > Canvas create empty child: "VehiclesSpeed"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "VehiclesSpeed"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Bottom Left

Pos X: 146.3
Pos Y: 143

Width: 300
Height: 300


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 350: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck01Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck01Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 351: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 352: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 353: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck01_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 354: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck01 attach script: (SixWheelTruck01Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck01Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck01Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck01"

In: "SixWheelTruck01" > SixWheelTruck01 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck01_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck01_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck01_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck01_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck01Speedometer
SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck01_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck01_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

      DuneBuggy06_EntryKey
