      SixWheelTruck01_EntryKey
EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 355:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck02_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck02_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 356: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 357: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck02"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 27 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_02

Then move "SixWheelTruck02" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 358: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck02" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 359: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck02Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck02Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 340: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck02" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 341: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck02" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 342: Add to: SixWheelTruck02 (SixWheelTruck02Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck02Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck02"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck02 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 343: Add to: SixWheelTruck02Camera (SixWheelTruck02Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck02Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck02Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck02 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 344: Add to: SixWheelTruck02 (SixWheelTruck02Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck02Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck02"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck02
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck02_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 345: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck02Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck02Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 346: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 347: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 348: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck02_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 349: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck02 attach script: (SixWheelTruck02Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck02Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck02Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck02"

In: "SixWheelTruck02" > SixWheelTruck02 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck02_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck02_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck02_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck02_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck02Speedometer
SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck02_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck02_SpeedText

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 350:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck03_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck03_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 351: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 352: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck03"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 33 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_03

Then move "SixWheelTruck03" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 353: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck03" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 354: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck03Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck03Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 355: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck03" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 356: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck03" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 357: Add to: SixWheelTruck03 (SixWheelTruck03Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck03Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck03"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck03 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 358: Add to: SixWheelTruck03Camera (SixWheelTruck03Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck03Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck03Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck03 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 359: Add to: SixWheelTruck03 (SixWheelTruck03Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck03Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck03"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck03
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck03_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 360: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck03Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck03Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 361: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 362: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 363: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck03_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 364: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck03 attach script: (SixWheelTruck03Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck03Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck03Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck03"

In: "SixWheelTruck03" > SixWheelTruck03 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck03_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck03_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck03_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck03_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck03Speedometer
SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck03_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck03_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      Humvee06_EntryKey    
      Sedan01_EntryKey
      Sedan02_EntryKey
      Sedan03_EntryKey
      Sedan04_EntryKey 
      Sedan05_EntryKey
      Sedan06_EntryKey     
      SixWheelTruck01_EntryKey
      SixWheelTruck02_EntryKey      
      SixWheelTruck03_EntryKey      
EventSystem


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 365:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck04_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck04_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 366: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 367: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck04"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 39 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_04

Then move "SixWheelTruck04" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 368: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck04" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 369: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck04Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck04Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 370: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck04" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 371: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck04" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Step 372: Add to: SixWheelTruck04 (SixWheelTruck04Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck04Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck04"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck04 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 373: Add to: SixWheelTruck04Camera (SixWheelTruck04Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck04Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck04Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck04 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 374: Add to: SixWheelTruck04 (SixWheelTruck04Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck04Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck04"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck04
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck04_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 375: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck04Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck04Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 376: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 377: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 378: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck04_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 379: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck04 attach script: (SixWheelTruck04Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck04Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck04Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck04"

In: "SixWheelTruck04" > SixWheelTruck04 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck04_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck04_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck04_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck04_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck04Speedometer
SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck04_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck04_SpeedText

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 380:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck05_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck05_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 381: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 382: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck05"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 45 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_05

Then move "SixWheelTruck05" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 383: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck05" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 384: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck05Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck05Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 385: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck05" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 386: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck05" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Notes: Current Summary

Mostly Collapsed:

    WheelColliders

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 387: Add to: SixWheelTruck05 (SixWheelTruck05Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck05Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck05"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck05 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 388: Add to: SixWheelTruck05Camera (SixWheelTruck05Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck05Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck05Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck05 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 389: Add to: SixWheelTruck05 (SixWheelTruck05Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck05Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck05"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck05
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck05_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 390: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck05Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck05Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 391: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 392: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 393: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck05_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 394: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck05 attach script: (SixWheelTruck05Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck05Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck05Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck05"

In: "SixWheelTruck05" > SixWheelTruck05 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck05_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck05_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck05_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck05_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck05Speedometer
SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck05_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck05_SpeedText

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 395:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "SixWheelTruck06_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "SixWheelTruck06_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 396: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Truck_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 397: Add: the next "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Truck_01 => "SixWheelTruck06"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 51 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_06

Then move "SixWheelTruck06" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 398: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck06" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 399: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "SixWheelTruck06Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "SixWheelTruck06Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 400: Add: empty "WheelMeshes" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck06" add empty as child named "WheelMeshes"

Set the Transform of "WheelMeshes":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Copy & paste the following meshes into "WheelMeshes" as children
(delete originals after as they are not needed since we copied them into new
location)

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Transforms should be fine and unaffected but, let us just mention them for
good measure.

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.6432184 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
---------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
---------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.6432184 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 401: Duplicate: empty "WheelMeshes" as "WheelColliders"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "SixWheelTruck06" duplicate "WheelMeshes" & rename to "WheelColliders"

Set the Transform of "WheelColliders":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:


Front Wheels:
-------------

Front Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400671
Front Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900671 (0.6400671+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

Rear Wheels:
------------

Rear Wheels Collider Radius: 0.6400672
Rear Wheels Collider Position Y: 0.7900672 (0.6400672+0.15) *

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02

Set both front "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400671
Set all rear  "Wheel Colliders" radius: 0.6400672

We will need to now edit these infos:


SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl
---------------------

Position: X: -1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr
---------------------

Position: X: 1.056318 Y: 0.7900671 Z: 2.190251
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02
------------------------

Position: X: -1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -0.5653239
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02
------------------------

Position: X: 1.172493 Y: 0.7900672 Z: -2.031397
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 402: Add to: SixWheelTruck06 (SixWheelTruck06Controller.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck06Controller.cs) to "SixWheelTruck06"

Adjust the following settings:

Require Components:
-------------------

Rigidbody: SixWheelTruck06 (Rigidbody)

Wheel Transforms:
-----------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Transform)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Transform)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Transform)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Transform)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Transform)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Transform)

WheelColliders:
---------------

Front Left: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fl (Wheel Collider)
Front Right: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_fr (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Left 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rl_02 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 01: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_01 (Wheel Collider)
Rear Right 02: SM_Veh_Truck_Wheel_rr_02 (Wheel Collider)

In Rigidbody:
-------------

Set Rigibody Mass: 3500


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 403: Add to: SixWheelTruck06Camera (SixWheelTruck06Camera.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck06Camera.cs) to "SixWheelTruck06Camera"

Adjust Settings:

Transforms:
-----------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck06 (Transform)


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 404: Add to: SixWheelTruck06 (SixWheelTruck06Entry.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach component / script (SixWheelTruck06Entry.cs) to "SixWheelTruck06"

Adjust the following settings:


Game Objects:
-------------

Six Wheel Truck: SixWheelTruck06
Player: Player
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck06_EntryKey


In Box Collider:
----------------

Is Trigger: Yes

Edit Collider: YES!* 

* Edit the collider to be around the vehicle doors makings sure to extend the
  collider a good bit out away from doors so as to allow for a good trigger
  zone. Here is just an example that I suggest you tweak further to you
  likings and needs:

Center: X: 0.007755756 Y: 1.946628 Z: 2.775195
Size: X: 4.208336 Y: 2.19522 Z: 1.470402


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 405: In "VehiclesSpeed" create empty child: "SixWheelTruck06Speedometer"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck06Speedometer"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300

* something to note on placement: ok, when you add the script later in steps
  you will notice an option in script settings for setting on choice of
  either kph or mph in regards to SpeedText output, ok, with taking that into
  account you can now possibly understand the following note about placement
  of the interface items specific to such, mkay lets say that these setup
  steps suggest setting all on the bottom left and that is because we are
  using mph for the speed text outputdisplay thus such would make sence to
  have speedometer and speed text on left bottom, but, ok, say you select kph
  as speed text output, then it just might make sence to set the interface
  items to the bottom right and that is why these suggestions are mentioned.
  The choice is yours on that.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 406: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoGuage"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoGuage"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Width: 300
Height: 300


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Guage

Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 407: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add IMG: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoNeedle"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoNeedle"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -24

Width: 260
Height: 260


In: "Image"


Source Image: Speedometer-Needle

Color: (Suggested Hex) 6B3232


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 408: In Interface > Canvas > VehiclesSpeed add TMP TEXT: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedText"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In: "SixWheelTruck06_SpeedText"

Adjust:

Rect Transform:
---------------

Middle Center

Pos Y: -120.4

Width: 200
Height: 50

Text Input:
-----------

0 mph


Font Size: 36 *

Vertex Color: (Suggested Hex) FFFFFF

Alignment: Center Middle

Face:
Dilate: 0.21 *

Outline: YES
Thickness: 0.121 *

Underlay: YES
Dilate: 0.02 *
Softness: 0.522 *

* Note these are just suggestions for you then to tweak and adjust further to
  your likings.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 409: In Vehicles > SixWheelTruck06 attach script: (SixWheelTruck06Speedometer.cs)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Attach SixWheelTruck06Speedometer script: (SixWheelTruck06Speedometer.cs) to
Vehicle: "SixWheelTruck06"

In: "SixWheelTruck06" > SixWheelTruck06 Speedometer (Script)

Adjust the minimal settings as far as what is min needed: (Needle IMG and
Speed Text)

Needle: SixWheelTruck06_Needle

Speed Text: SixWheelTruck06_SpeedText (Text Mesh Pro UGUI)

Interface Parent Object: SixWheelTruck06_Speedometer
Interface IMG01 Object: SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoGuage
Interface IMG02 Object: SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoNeedle
Interface Text Object: SixWheelTruck06_SpeedText


Note: Lastly,  we need to disable
the listed objects found below as we do not want these objects to display
prior to awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by
default and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive
item in start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable
these objects in the editor.

Game Objects:

SixWheelTruck06Speedometer
SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoGuage
SixWheelTruck06_SpeedoNeedle
SixWheelTruck06_SpeedText


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Notes: Current Summary

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Note: Ok, by now your heirarchy should look like this:

Mostly Collapsed:

Environment
Player
Vehicles
  ArmoredTruck01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View
  ArmoredTruck02
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes
    WheelColliders   
    View     
  ArmoredTruck03
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_Glass_01
    SM_Veh_Armored_Car_SteeringW_01  
    WheelMeshes

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 410:  Create child of "VehiclesEntry" add Text tmp: "TankRU01_EntryKey"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Create as a child of "VehiclesEntry" add TextMeshPro Text: "TankRU01_EntryKey"

Layer: "UI"


Rect Transform: 
---------------

Set at "Top Center"

Position: X: 0 Y: -50   Z: 0 
Width: 100
Height: 100


Text Input: Drive [E]
Font Size: 36

Alignment: Center & Middle

Face:
-----
Dilate: 0.21

Outline: Yes Thickness: 0.121

Underlay: Yes Softness: 0.522

Note: The face, outline and underlay are merely starting suggestions that you
can tweak further to your desired likings as well as any other related
settings of the likes.

Note: Lastly, disable this object as we do not want this to display prior to
awake or start methods and to do this we will disable this object by default
and then there is a wrapper in the script that will find the inactive item in
start thus doing what will be needed. So yeah, make sure to disable this
object in the editor.

Ok, now that this part is done we can start moving to other setup steps...


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 411: Identify: the next "Vehicle Prefab"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Let us first identify and locate the "Vehicle Prefab" we are going to use.

Assets > PolygonBattleRoyale > Prefabs > Vehicles

SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_01


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 412: Add: the "Vehicle Prefab" to Scene

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Drag the mentioned "Vehicle Prefab" into the scene & unpack the prefab completely.

Next, rename the vehicle prefabs:

SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_01 => "TankRU01"

Next, set the Transform:

Position: X: 58 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Material: PolygonBattleRoyale_Veh_01

Then move "TankRU01" into the empty: "Vehicles" as child of.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 413: Add: empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In "TankRU01" add empty as child named "View"

Set the Transform of "View":

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Step 414: Add: "Camera" in empty "View" as child

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------


In the empty: "View" add "Camera" component named: "TankRU01Camera"

Tag: Untagged

Depth: 0

Set the Transform of "TankRU01Camera":

Position: X: 0 Y: 2.8 Z: -8.4 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Position: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Rotation: X: 0 Y: 0 Z: 0 
Scale:    X: 1 Y: 1 Z: 1

Since you duplicated "WheelMeshes" & renamed to "WheelColliders" there should
be the children already present with matching infos...

Left:

SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_01
SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_02

SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_R_05
SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_R_06
SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_R_07


Prior to the deletion of contents in WheelColliders if you desired to
determine the wheel radius so as to eventually use with Wheel Colliders well,
you could attach a Sphere Collider and gain Radius from that and then delete
the sphere collider after as such would no longer be necessary but instead to
avoid needing to do such I will provide that info so you do not necessarily
need to do so.

These details are important:

* Wheel colliders need +0.15 on the Y to function as intended as per
  documentation

In "WheelColliders" children: * (since all are already present in WheelMeshes
and not needed for Wheel Colliders)

* Delete Mesh Filter
* Delete Mesh Renderer

Add Component "Wheel Collider" to each:

Left:

SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_01

----------------------

Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_03 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_04 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_05 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_06 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_L_07 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.3966376

Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_R_02 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
Set SM_Veh_Tank_Russia_Track_Wheel_R_03 "Wheel Collider" radius: 0.4486088
